data.name: ICL Phosphate Specialty - HALOX®
data.description:
ICL Phosphate Specialty is a division of ICL Specialty Products Inc., one of ICL’s (Israel Chemicals Limited) core operating segments. ICL is a leading global specialty phosphate producer committed to fulfilling humanity’s ever-evolving needs.


Our HALOX® corrosion inhibitors were established in 1972 to meet regulatory, industry and customer demand for lead and chromate-free non-toxic pigments for corrosion resistant and tannin stain resistant coatings. For almost 50 years, HALOX® corrosion inhibitors have provided the paint and coatings industry with innovative corrosion inhibiting solutions.


ICL Phosphate Specialty is ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and RC 14001 certified. We are committed to our Responsible Care initiatives and consistent with the Responsible Care® code of Product Stewardship. We remain fully engaged in the implementation of the European Union's Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals legislation (REACH). The impact it will have on the future availability of chemicals is of vital importance for ICL Phosphate Specialty, our customers and the entire global chemical industry.

data.name: LOPON
data.description: LOPON® defoamers are highly effective solutions for interior and exterior emulsion paints and plasters, silicone resin paints, emulsion silicate paints and plasters, and adhesives. LOPON® E series defoamers are alternatives to silicone and mineral oil based products. Our selection includes products developed from bio-renewable raw materials.

data.name: HALOX
data.description: HALOX® Corrosion Inhibitors are effective against flash rusting and in-can corrosion, though the benefits of using these products does not end there. Our HALOX® Corrosion Inhibitors are ideally suited for high gloss, thin film, and clear coat applications. They also provide superior synergy when used in combination with inorganic corrosion inhibitors in traditional coatings. To achieve desired performance of your resin system proper selection of HALOX® Inhibitors is essential.

data.name: POLYRON
data.description: POLYRON® series is a high capacity powder designed for binding calcium and other metal ions with rapid viscosity reduction during the dispersion process.

data.name: POLYRON® N
data.description: POLYRON® N is a white powder dispersing agent for emulsion paints, plasters, and adhesives. Its high dispersing effectivity quickly achieves an optimal particle size. It is ideal for use as a dispersing agent for emulsion paints and plasters, and it reduces water hardness and deflocculates pigments and fillers in aqueous suspensions. It can achieve high solid contents in emulsion paints with low viscosity.

data.name: HALOX® CW-314
data.description: HALOX® CW-314 is a heavy metal-free, non-toxic, anti-corrosive pigment designed for use in waterborne and solvent-borne protective coating systems. It is particularly suitable for systems where 21 CFR 175.300 approval or compliance with ANSI or NSF standards is required. HALOX® CW-314 is highly effective in improving the infrared (IR) reflectance and thermal emissivity of elastomeric roof coatings. It enhances the total solar reflectance (TSR) while maintaining dirt pick-up resistance (DPUR) and preventing mildew growth. It can be used alone or in combination with other non-toxic corrosion inhibitors and mineral pigments in the formulation of environmentally friendly specialty paints.

data.name: HALOX® 520
data.description: HALOX® 520 is a liquid organic corrosion inhibitor primarily designed for use in water-borne coating systems. It contains dual functionality as a corrosion inhibitor and an adhesion promoter. HALOX® 520 may be used in waterborne formulations such as 2 pack epoxy systems, 1 and 2 pack polyurethanes, acrylics (especially epoxy/amine-functionalized), and hybrid systems. It may also be used as a metal pretreatment additive.

data.name: HALOX® RC-980

summary.name: Synonyms
items: (±)-1,2-Propanediol, (±)-Propylene glycol, (RS)-1,2-Propanediol, 1,2-(RS)-Propanediol, 1,2-Dihydroxypropane, 1,2-Propanediol, 1,2-Propylene glycol, 2-Hydroxypropanol, 2,3-Propanediol, DL-1,2-Propanediol, dl-Propylene glycol, Isopropylene glycol, Methylethyl glycol, Methylethylene glycol, Monopropylene glycol, NSC 69860, α-Propylene glycol

data.description: HALOX® RC-980 is an organic additive designed to convert red rust to black iron oxide. It can be used in slightly acidic waterborne vinyl or PVDC binders applied to rusted steel substrates. It converts the rust within minutes of the coating application and forms a black iron oxide barrier that can be further top-coated with water or solvent-based paints. It does not contain tannic acid, oxime chelates, phosphates, or phosphoric acid.

data.name: HALOX® CW-291

summary.name: Synonyms
items: Calcium borate (CaB2O4), Calcium hypoborate (CaB2O4), Calcium metaborate (CaB2O4)

data.description: HALOX® CW-291 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. It is not recommended for use in immersion or semi-immersion environments. HALOX® CW-291 has the lowest oil absorption of all our borosilicate products and is recommended for use in protective coating systems based on alkyd technology. Because of its low oil absorption, HALOX® CW-291 is specifically suggested for use in high-solids, medium-gloss topcoats, DTM (direct-to-metal) finishes, and self-priming systems. HALOX® CW-291 is compliant with ASTM D 4288-83, specification for calcium borosilicate pigment type 1, class B.

data.name: LOPON® ST
data.description: LOPON® ST is a highly effective stabilizer for emulsion silicate paints that prevents the formation of a polymeric network by the silicate groups in water glass during storage. The viscosity of the paint quickly levels off and remains stable for an extended period of time.

data.name: TARGON® B 350
data.description: TARGON® B 350 is a specialized retarder designed for gypsum formulations featuring Ca(OH)2. This industrial additive is ideal for situations demanding rapid setting, such as anhydrite floor screeds. With a focus on quick set time, TARGON® B 350 ensures efficient performance in both gypsum and floor screed applications.

data.name: HALOX® XTAIN® L-44
data.description: HALOX® XTAIN® L-44 is a very effective liquid tannin stain-blocking additive that provides high performance and good compatibility in most water-based coating systems. Excellent tannin stain blocking properties can be achieved with HALOX® XTAIN® L-44 without the need for zinc oxide, which is required to achieve performance by most tannin blocking polymers on the market today. HALOX® XTAIN® L-44 eliminates the need for zinc oxide without sacrificing performance, resulting in improved package stability and shelf life of the coating system.

data.name: TARGON® FM
data.description: TARGON® FM is a processing aid employed as an auxiliary agent for cementitious leveling compounds. It constitutes a blend of sodium phosphate, hydroxypolycarboxylic acid, and a wetting agent. This product is particularly well-suited for ternary systems involving Portland cement, gypsum, and refractory cement.

They also provide superior synergy when used in combination with inorganic corrosion inhibitors in traditional coatings. To achieve desired performance of your resin system proper selection of HALOX® Inhibitors is essential.

Our HALOX® Corrosion Inhibitors are ideally suited for high gloss, thin film, and clear coat applications. They also provide superior synergy when used in combination with inorganic corrosion inhibitors in traditional coatings. To achieve desired performance of your resin system proper selection of HALOX® Inhibitors is essential.
data.seo_title: HALOX - ICL Phosphate Specialty - HALOX® - Knowde
data.seo_description: HALOX® Corrosion Inhibitors are effective against flash rusting and in-can corrosion, though the benefits of using these products does not end there. Our HALOX® Corrosion Inhibitors are ideally suited

content_blocks.html: HALOX® showcases its dedication to corrosion protection through our very own selection of specialty products. In the past, HALOX® has focused on corrosion inhibitors for the paint and coatings industry, but other markets also benefit from our technology and chemistry expertise. That’s why we continue to develop specialty products for industries that use corrosion inhibitors for applications other than paint and coatings, such as the concrete, water treatment, inks, heat transfer fluids, and gas and oil industries.

data.name: HALOX® 350
data.description: HALOX® 350 is a highly active organic corrosion inhibitor with 97–100% solids, specifically designed to prevent flash rust and in-can corrosion while also providing temporary corrosion protection. This product is an effective alternative to toxic nitrite-based flash rust inhibitors. It is in the form of a slightly yellow powder.

data.name: HALOX® 430 JM
data.description: HALOX® 430 JM is a non-toxic, heavy metal-free anti-corrosive pigment designed for use in waterborne and solventborne protective coating systems. HALOX® 430 JM is based on a unique synergy between an ion scavenging and passivation mechanism. It is recommended for use in long-term applications where the use of heavy metals, such as zinc, strontium, barium, molybdenum, and chromate, is of concern.

data.name: HALOX® 515 LFG
data.description: HALOX® 515 LFG is a low-freeze-grade liquid organic corrosion inhibitor suitable for high-gloss (direct-to-metal) coating systems. When used as recommended, HALOX® 515 LFG provides cost-effective flash rust protection and long-term corrosion protection. It is effective for thin film applications (<2 mils). HALOX® 515 LFG is heavy metal-free, nitrite-free, and does not contain chromates or phosphates. Testing with HALOX® 515 LFG has shown improved adhesion at the scribe and good humidity resistance. Additionally, it has been proven effective as a flash rust inhibitor on weld seams.

data.name: HALOX® 550 WF

summary.name: Synonyms
items: (3-Glycidoxypropyl)trimethoxysilane, (γ-Glycidoxypropyl)trimethoxysilane, [[3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propoxy]methyl]oxirane, [3-(2,3-Epoxypropoxy)propyl]trimethoxysilane, [3-(Glycidyloxy)propyl]trimethoxysilane, [γ-(Glycidyloxy)propyl]trimethoxysilane, 1-(Glycidyloxy)-3-(trimethoxysilyl)propane, 2-((3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propyloxy)methyl)oxirane, 2-[[3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propoxy]methyl]oxirane, 3-(Glycidyloxy)propyltrimethoxylsilane, 3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propyl glycidyl ether, Epoxypropoxypropyltrimethoxysilane, Glycidoxypropyltrimethoxysilane, Glycidyl 3-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl ether, Glycidyl γ-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl ether, Glycidyloxypropyltrimethoxysilane, NSC 93590, Trimethoxy-γ-glycidoxypropylsilane, Trimethoxy(3-(oxiran-2-ylmethoxy)propyl)silane, Trimethoxy(3-glycidoxypropyl)silane, Trimethoxy(3-glycidyloxypropyl)silane, γ-(2,3-Epoxypropoxy)propyltrimethoxysilane, γ-Glycidyl ether propyltrimethoxysilane, γ-Triglycidoxypropyltrimethoxysilane

data.description: HALOX® 550 WF is a water-free (WF) corrosion inhibitor and adhesion promoter that uses a sol-gel-based formula. It is designed to protect a variety of coatings, including waterborne and solventborne clear coats, glossy direct-to-metal coatings, thin-film coatings, acrylic emulsions, polyurethanes, epoxies, alkyds, water-reducible alkyds, PVB wash primers, and polyester resins. This product is suitable for use in low-pH and acid-catalyzed systems.

data.name: HALOX® 570 LS
data.description: HALOX® 570 LS is a ready-to-use liquid version of our popular organic corrosion inhibitor, HALOX® 570, which requires no dilution. It is designed for use in water-based industrial and decorative coatings to provide flash rust and long-term corrosion protection on metal surfaces. It is especially effective along weld seams to prevent galvanic corrosion. HALOX® 570 LS may be used in formulations based on water-based acrylics, epoxy esters, 2-component epoxy, water-reducible alkyds, and water-based polyurethanes. HALOX® 570 LS may be used in both water-based primers and direct-to-metal topcoats. In direct-to-metal coatings, HALOX® 570 LS has a minimal effect on gloss reduction.

data.name: HALOX® BW-100
data.description: HALOX® BW-100 is a white, nonrefractive, tannin stain-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems and has been specifically designed as a tannin stain inhibitor, providing performance and compatibility in a variety of resin systems such as acrylic latexes, vinyl acrylic latexes, styrenated acrylic latexes, and solventborne alkyds.

data.name: HALOX® BW-111

summary.name: Synonyms
items: Barium Dihydrogen Phosphate, Barium Phosphate Monobasic

data.description: HALOX® BW-111 is a white, non-refractive pigment used as a corrosion inhibitor in protective coating systems. It is specifically recommended for use in solvent-borne epoxy systems, including both conventional and high-solids coatings. The recommended loading levels for HALOX® BW-111 range from 5–10% based on the total formula weight for conventional systems and from 10–20% based on the total formula weight for higher solids systems.

data.name: HALOX® BW-191

summary.name: Synonyms
items: Barium Dihydrogen Phosphate, Barium Phosphate Monobasic

data.description: HALOX® BW-191 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. It is recommended for use in most waterborne systems, such as latexes and water reducibles, and due to its lower oil absorption, it can also be effective in anticorrosive high-solids coatings. On the other hand, HALOX® BW-111 is recommended for use in solventborne epoxy systems, both conventional and high-solids.

data.name: HALOX® CW-22/221

summary.name: Synonyms
items: Calcium borate (CaB2O4), Calcium hypoborate (CaB2O4), Calcium metaborate (CaB2O4)

data.description: HALOX® CW-22/221 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. It is not recommended for use in immersion or semi-immersion environments. HALOX® CW-22/221 is recommended for use in primer systems based on traditional solvent alkyd technology. It can effectively be formulated into such resins as medium- and long-oil alkyds. HALOX® CW-22/221 is compliant with ASTM D7089, which specifies the requirements for calcium borosilicate pigments for use in paints.

data.name: HALOX® CW-2230

summary.name: Synonyms
items: Calcium borate (CaB2O4), Calcium hypoborate (CaB2O4), Calcium metaborate (CaB2O4)

data.description: HALOX® CW-2230 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. It is not recommended for use in immersion or semi-immersion environments. HALOX® CW-2230 has the highest borate content and can be effectively formulated into resins such as medium and long-oil alkyds, epoxy-esters, and modified alkyd systems. HALOX® CW-2230 is compliant with ASTM D 4288-83, specification for calcium borosilicate pigment type 2.

data.name: HALOX® CW-291

summary.name: Synonyms
items: Calcium borate (CaB2O4), Calcium hypoborate (CaB2O4), Calcium metaborate (CaB2O4)

data.description: HALOX® CW-291 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. It is not recommended for use in immersion or semi-immersion environments. HALOX® CW-291 has the lowest oil absorption of all our borosilicate products and is recommended for use in protective coating systems based on alkyd technology. Because of its low oil absorption, HALOX® CW-291 is specifically suggested for use in high-solids, medium-gloss topcoats, DTM (direct-to-metal) finishes, and self-priming systems. HALOX® CW-291 is compliant with ASTM D 4288-83, specification for calcium borosilicate pigment type 1, class B.

data.name: HALOX® CW-314
data.description: HALOX® CW-314 is a heavy metal-free, non-toxic, anti-corrosive pigment designed for use in waterborne and solvent-borne protective coating systems. It is particularly suitable for systems where 21 CFR 175.300 approval or compliance with ANSI or NSF standards is required. HALOX® CW-314 is highly effective in improving the infrared (IR) reflectance and thermal emissivity of elastomeric roof coatings. It enhances the total solar reflectance (TSR) while maintaining dirt pick-up resistance (DPUR) and preventing mildew growth. It can be used alone or in combination with other non-toxic corrosion inhibitors and mineral pigments in the formulation of environmentally friendly specialty paints.

data.name: HALOX® CW-491
data.description: HALOX® CW-491 is a white, non-refractive, heavy metal-free pigment used as a corrosion inhibitor in protective coating systems. It is versatile and can be used with a variety of solvent and waterborne resin systems. The recommended loading levels for HALOX® CW-491 vary depending on the type of system used. For waterborne systems, the recommended loading levels range from 5–8% based on the total formula weight, while for solventborne systems, the recommended loading levels range from 7–12% based on the total formula weight.

data.name: HALOX® CZ-170
data.description: HALOX® CZ-170 is a versatile pigment used in protective coating systems to inhibit corrosion and tannin staining. It is a great replacement for zinc oxide and can be used in high-gloss and thin-film applications due to its finer particle size and narrow distribution. With a gloss of over 75 units at 60° and a film thickness of less than 1.0 mils, or 25 microns, HALOX® CZ-170 is a great option for a variety of coating needs. It can be used to protect both metal and wood substrates, making it a universal option for coating systems.

data.name: HALOX® FLASH-X® 150

summary.name: Synonyms
items: E 250, Nitrous Acid Soda, Sodium nitrite (NaNO2)

data.description: HALOX® FLASH-X® 150 is an effective liquid additive used in the manufacture of water-based protective coatings to inhibit flash rust and in-can rusting. Testing has demonstrated that HALOX® FLASH-X® 150 is highly effective at relatively low loading levels when compared to other flash and in-can rust inhibitors. It has also shown excellent flash rust inhibitive performance on various metal substrates, including iron, steel, galvanized iron, galvalume, and zincalume.

data.name: HALOX® RC-980

summary.name: Synonyms
items: (±)-1,2-Propanediol, (±)-Propylene glycol, (RS)-1,2-Propanediol, 1,2-(RS)-Propanediol, 1,2-Dihydroxypropane, 1,2-Propanediol, 1,2-Propylene glycol, 2-Hydroxypropanol, 2,3-Propanediol, DL-1,2-Propanediol, dl-Propylene glycol, Isopropylene glycol, Methylethyl glycol, Methylethylene glycol, Monopropylene glycol, NSC 69860, α-Propylene glycol

data.description: HALOX® RC-980 is an organic additive designed to convert red rust to black iron oxide. It can be used in slightly acidic waterborne vinyl or PVDC binders applied to rusted steel substrates. It converts the rust within minutes of the coating application and forms a black iron oxide barrier that can be further top-coated with water or solvent-based paints. It does not contain tannic acid, oxime chelates, phosphates, or phosphoric acid.

data.name: HALOX® SW-111
data.description: HALOX® SW-111 is a white, nonrefractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. HALOX® SW-111 is recommended for use in most water-borne and solvent-borne epoxies. HALOX® SW-111 can be formulated into most water-reducible resin systems and corrosion-resistant caulks and sealants.

data.name: HALOX® SZP-391
data.description: HALOX® SZP-391 is a white, nonrefractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment that is highly efficient and versatile. It is recommended for use in a wide variety of resin systems, such as alkyds (both traditional and high solids), epoxies, latexes, water-reducible alkyds, high acid value resins, catalyzed baking systems, and vinylidene chloride latexes. Its fine particle size and low oil absorption make HALOX® SZP-391 the preferred pigment for thin-film applications (<1 mil or 25 microns).

data.name: HALOX® SZP-391 JM
data.description: HALOX® SZP-391 JM is an efficient and versatile corrosion-inhibiting pigment. It is a white, nonrefractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. HALOX® SZP-391 JM is equally effective in such resins as alkyds (both traditional and high solids), epoxies, latexes, water-reducible alkyds, high acid value resins, catalyzed baking systems, and vinylidene chloride-based latexes and is recommended for use in a wide variety of resin systems.

data.name: HALOX® SZP-395
data.description: HALOX® SZP-395 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. HALOX® SZP-395 is the most efficient and versatile corrosion-inhibiting pigment. It is recommended for use in a wide variety of resin systems and is equally effective in such resins as alkyds (both traditional and high solids), epoxies, latexes, water-reducible alkyds, high acid value resins, catalyzed baking systems, and vinylidene chloride latexes. The fine particle size and low oil absorption of HALOX® SZP-395 make it the pigment of choice in thin film applications (<1 mil or 25 microns).

data.name: HALOX® XTAIN® A
data.description: HALOX® XTAIN® A is a white, non-refractive, tannin stain-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems. HALOX® XTAIN® A is a highly efficient tannin stain inhibitor providing a high level of performance and compatibility in a variety of resin systems such as styrene-butadiene latexes, acrylic latexes, vinyl acrylic latexes, and solventborne alkyds.

data.name: HALOX® XTAIN® L-44
data.description: HALOX® XTAIN® L-44 is a very effective liquid tannin stain-blocking additive that provides high performance and good compatibility in most water-based coating systems. Excellent tannin stain blocking properties can be achieved with HALOX® XTAIN® L-44 without the need for zinc oxide, which is required to achieve performance by most tannin blocking polymers on the market today. HALOX® XTAIN® L-44 eliminates the need for zinc oxide without sacrificing performance, resulting in improved package stability and shelf life of the coating system.

data.name: HALOX® Zinc Phosphate
data.description: HALOX® Zinc Phosphate is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment that is widely used in protective coating systems. It is also known as zinc phosphate-dihydrate and is characterized by a narrow particle size distribution, with an upper particle size limit of 10 microns and a mean particle size of 5 microns. This pigment is highly versatile and serves as a standard corrosion inhibitor for most high-performance resin systems, including vinyl, chlorinated rubbers, and epoxies. It is especially recommended for high acid-value resins, catalyzed baking systems, and vinylidene chloride latexes. In addition, HALOX® Zinc Phosphate is an ideal choice for thin film applications (less than 1 mil or 25 microns). It meets the ASTM D 6280-98 specification for zinc phosphate pigment type I and is widely used in the industry.

data.name: HALOX® Z-PLEX® 111
data.description: HALOX® Z-PLEX 111 is a corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coating systems that is highly versatile and more cost-effective than commercial zinc phosphate. HALOX® Z-PLEX 111 can provide a higher level of corrosion protection than commercial zinc phosphate when used as an equal-weight replacement.

data.name: HALOX® Z-PLEX® 250
data.description: HALOX® Z-PLEX® 250 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in various protective coatings. It is classified as Zn3(PO4)2.2H2O (dihydrate) and is compliant with ASTM D6280, Specification for Zinc Phosphate Pigment Type I. The recommended loading levels for HALOX® Z-PLEX® 250 range from 5–10% based on the total formula weight.

data.name: HALOX® Z-PLEX® 750
data.description: HALOX® Z-PLEX® 750 is an inorganic and organic hybrid corrosion inhibitor primarily designed for coatings and primers on metal surfaces. HALOX® Z-PLEX® 750 is specifically designed for use in a variety of solventborne or waterborne applications to cost-effectively provide the traditional function of an inorganic corrosion inhibitor with the benefits of an organic corrosion inhibitor.

data.name: HALOX® 430
data.description: HALOX® 430 is a non-toxic, heavy metal-free anticorrosive pigment designed for use in waterborne and solventborne protective coating systems. HALOX® 430 is based on a unique synergy between an ion scavenging and passivation mechanism. It is recommended for use in long-term applications where the use of heavy metals, such as zinc, strontium, barium, molybdenum, and chromate, is of concern.

data.name: HALOX® FLASH-X® 330

summary.name: Synonyms
items: beta-Dimethylaminoethyl Alcohol, beta-Hydroxyethyldimethylamine, Deanol, Dimethyl(2-Hydroxyethyl)Amine, Dimethyl(Hydroxyethyl)Amine, Dimethylaminoethanol, Dimethylethanolamine, Dimethylmonoethanolamine, DMAE, DMEA, N,N-Dimethyl-2-Aminoethanol, N,N-Dimethylethanolamine, Norcholine, Propamine A

data.description: HALOX® FLASH-X® 330 is a liquid additive that is effective in preventing flash rust and in-can rusting in waterborne protective coatings without the use of nitrites. It is a nitrite-free product that provides excellent flash rust inhibitory performance on various metal substrates and is recommended for use in high-gloss systems. It does not detract from gloss, is easy to use, and can be incorporated at any stage of coating manufacture. Additionally, it can be post-added to any coating system with ease. However, it is important to check compatibility before use, as with any additive.

data.name: HALOX® 515
data.description: HALOX® 515 is a liquid organic corrosion inhibitor for high-gloss (direct-to-metal) coating systems and will provide cost-effective flash rust protection and long-term corrosion protection when used as recommended. HALOX® 515 is also effective for thin film applications (<2 mils). HALOX® 515 is heavy metal-free, nitrite-free, and contains no chromates or phosphates. Testing with HALOX® 515 has shown improved adhesion at the scribe and good humidity resistance. Testing has also shown HALOX® 515 to be effective as a flash rust inhibitor on weld seams.

data.name: HALOX® 520
data.description: HALOX® 520 is a liquid organic corrosion inhibitor primarily designed for use in water-borne coating systems. It contains dual functionality as a corrosion inhibitor and an adhesion promoter. HALOX® 520 may be used in waterborne formulations such as 2 pack epoxy systems, 1 and 2 pack polyurethanes, acrylics (especially epoxy/amine-functionalized), and hybrid systems. It may also be used as a metal pretreatment additive.

data.name: HALOX® 550

summary.name: Synonyms
items: (3-Glycidoxypropyl)trimethoxysilane, (γ-Glycidoxypropyl)trimethoxysilane, [[3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propoxy]methyl]oxirane, [3-(2,3-Epoxypropoxy)propyl]trimethoxysilane, [3-(Glycidyloxy)propyl]trimethoxysilane, [γ-(Glycidyloxy)propyl]trimethoxysilane, 1-(Glycidyloxy)-3-(trimethoxysilyl)propane, 2-((3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propyloxy)methyl)oxirane, 2-[[3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propoxy]methyl]oxirane, 3-(Glycidyloxy)propyltrimethoxylsilane, 3-(Trimethoxysilyl)propyl glycidyl ether, Epoxypropoxypropyltrimethoxysilane, Glycidoxypropyltrimethoxysilane, Glycidyl 3-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl ether, Glycidyl γ-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl ether, Glycidyloxypropyltrimethoxysilane, NSC 93590, Trimethoxy-γ-glycidoxypropylsilane, Trimethoxy(3-(oxiran-2-ylmethoxy)propyl)silane, Trimethoxy(3-glycidoxypropyl)silane, Trimethoxy(3-glycidyloxypropyl)silane, γ-(2,3-Epoxypropoxy)propyltrimethoxysilane, γ-Glycidyl ether propyltrimethoxysilane, γ-Triglycidoxypropyltrimethoxysilane

data.description: HALOX® 550 is a liquid organic-inorganic sol-gel corrosion inhibitor designed for corrosion protection in thin film coatings such as water and solvent-based finishes, high gloss DTM, conventional primers, acrylic clear coats, fast-drying lacquers, wash primers, anti-fingerprint coatings, and conversion coatings. It also increases hydrophobicity and is pH stable, making it compatible with both waterborne and solventborne coatings.

data.name: HALOX® 570
data.description: HALOX® 570 is an organic corrosion inhibitor designed for use in waterborne industrial and decorative coatings to provide flash rust and long-term corrosion protection on metal surfaces. HALOX® 570 is especially effective along weld seams and, in some cases, can also be used in solvent-based coatings and UV-cured systems. HALOX® 570 may be used in formulations based on waterborne acrylic latexes and co-polymers, styrene/acrylic latexes, acrylate epoxy esters, 2-pack epoxy systems, alkyds, alkyd/acrylic blends, and 1 or 2-pack polyurethane. HALOX® 570 may be used in both waterborne primers and direct-to-metal topcoats. In direct-to-metal coatings, HALOX® 570 has a minimal effect on gloss reduction.

data.name: HALOX® 630
data.description: HALOX® 630 is a liquid organic corrosion inhibitor for solvent-borne protective coatings on metal surfaces. It may be used in solventborne clear or pigmented coatings and in systems such as 2-pack epoxy systems, high-solids epoxy esters, alkyds, acrylic resins, and 2 pack polyurethane primers. However, in bake systems, the temperature should not exceed 150°C. It should be noted that yellowing may be observed with reactive isocyanates. HALOX® 630 provides superior corrosion resistance even over poorly prepared surfaces, such as adherent rust or oil contamination.

data.name: HALOX® 650
data.description: HALOX® 650 is an organic corrosion inhibitor primarily designed for coatings and primers on metal surfaces. It is specifically formulated for use in solvent-borne or powder-coating applications to provide long-term corrosion protection. HALOX® 650 can be used in a variety of applications, including coil coatings, resins such as thermoplastic acrylics or epoxies, powder coating systems such as polyester or TGIC, acid-catalyzed thermosetting systems such as melamine or urea-formaldehyde, and wash (etch) primers based on PVB.

data.name: HALOX® 700
data.description: HALOX® 700 is a white, non-refractive, corrosion-inhibiting pigment used in protective coatings. It provides extended protection in solvent-based and water-based epoxy and urethane coatings through the combination of zinc and aluminum phosphates. When used in alkyd and acrylic coatings, it is recommended to use it in combination with HALOX® Organic Corrosion Inhibitors for optimal performance.

data.name: HALOX® XTAIN® L-47
data.description: HALOX® XTAIN® L-47 is a liquid stain-inhibiting additive that is zinc-free, ammonia-free, and free of volatile organic compounds (VOCs). Specifically formulated to prevent tannin bleed, it is highly effective in waterborne coating systems such as acrylic emulsions and polyurethane dispersions (PUD) used on various wood species, including redwood, merbau, and oak. This advanced additive delivers exceptional performance while meeting European ecolabel requirements, as it does not rely on Zn2+ cations. HALOX® XTAIN® L-47 offers similar efficiency to its predecessor, HALOX® XTAIN® L-44.

data.name: ICL Phosphate Specialty - HALOX®
data.description:
ICL Phosphate Specialty is a division of ICL Specialty Products Inc., one of ICL’s (Israel Chemicals Limited) core operating segments. ICL is a leading global specialty phosphate producer committed to fulfilling humanity’s ever-evolving needs.


Our HALOX® corrosion inhibitors were established in 1972 to meet regulatory, industry and customer demand for lead and chromate-free non-toxic pigments for corrosion resistant and tannin stain resistant coatings. For almost 50 years, HALOX® corrosion inhibitors have provided the paint and coatings industry with innovative corrosion inhibiting solutions.


ICL Phosphate Specialty is ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and RC 14001 certified. We are committed to our Responsible Care initiatives and consistent with the Responsible Care® code of Product Stewardship. We remain fully engaged in the implementation of the European Union's Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals legislation (REACH). The impact it will have on the future availability of chemicals is of vital importance for ICL Phosphate Specialty, our customers and the entire global chemical industry.

WHY_KNOWDE.HEADING: Interact with over 8,000 suppliers, browse their catalogs, access documents and download starter formulations.

SECTION_1.HEADING: Instant access to the most comprehensive product catalog
SECTION_1.DESCRIPTION: Browse, search and filter the world's largest catalog of chemicals, ingredients and polymers.

SECTION_2.HEADING: Talk directly to suppliers' experts
SECTION_2.DESCRIPTION: Ask technical product questions, talk to a sales rep and inquire about pricing.

SECTION_3.HEADING: Order samples, request documents, and get quotes
SECTION_3.DESCRIPTION: Knowde concierge will handle all the details and ensure your requests are handled faster than ever.

WHY_CHEMISTRY.HEADING: Driving the world's most impactful industry forward.

SECTION_1.DESCRIPTION: At Knowde, we believe in the power of chemistry. We believe that easy and efficient access to information and raw materials enables you to work smarter and faster so you can continue to make a rich global impact.

SECTION_2.DESCRIPTION: Your innovations have decreased the carbon footprint of the automotive industry, imagined a sustainable agricultural future, developed alternative, biodegradable packaging materials, and changed the landscape of connectivity forever – to name a few. This is only the beginning.
SECTION_2.HEADING: We can't wait to see what you create with Knowde.

KNOWDE_PAY.LONG_DESCRIPTION: Now you can quickly transact online and avoid the hassle of establishing a new line of credit. Knowde will issue invoices and collect payments on behalf of the Supplier.

OFFLINE_PAYMENT.SUBHEADER: {companyName} will invoice your account off platform.

TAX_EXEMPTION.TITLE: Tax Exemption
TAX_EXEMPTION.LABEL: Cart items are tax-exempt
TAX_EXEMPTION.NOTE: Unchecking this will apply sales and use tax to all cart items

SUMMARY.NOTE: You will only be charged once your order ships.

ORDER.TITLE: Order
ORDER.SUBTITLE: An order receipt has been emailed to {email}
ORDER.NOTE: Check order status, print a PDF, or get tracking information at any time within your

ERRORS.SHIPPING_TITLE: Please fix the following before proceeding to payment

MULTIPLE_SUPPLIERS.TITLE: You have items from multiple suppliers in your cart
MULTIPLE_SUPPLIERS.MESSAGE: Please ensure all items are from the same supplier before proceeding to checkout.

CONFLICTING_INCOTERMS.TITLE: Items in your cart have conflicting Incoterms.
CONFLICTING_INCOTERMS.MESSAGE: Please remove any items until all Incoterms match.

ITEM_EXPIRED.TITLE: The quote for this line item has expired, please request a new quote from the seller.

BILLING_ADDRESS.TITLE: A Billing Address is required
BILLING_ADDRESS.MISSING_EMAIL: The selected address needs a billing email. Please edit and save again.

TERMS.TITLE: You must agree to the Ecommerce Terms & Conditions.

CURRENCY_MISMATCH.TITLE: Your Cart can only contain products with the same currency. Products with different currencies are moved to Saved for Later

ITEM_QUANTITY_LESS_THAN_MOQ.TITLE: You have entered a package quantity less than the Minimum Order Quantity.
ITEM_QUANTITY_LESS_THAN_MOQ.MESSAGE: The seller may not fulfill production at this level.

ITEM_QUANTITY_MORE_THAN_MAX_QUANTITY.TITLE: You have entered a package quantity more than the Maximum Order Quantity.
ITEM_QUANTITY_MORE_THAN_MAX_QUANTITY.MESSAGE: The seller may not fulfill production at this level.

ITEM_NEARLY_EXPIRED.TITLE: The quote for this line item will expire in less than a month.
ITEM_NEARLY_EXPIRED.MESSAGE: Please order before Quote Expiry Date.

PAGE_MOBILE.DESCRIPTION: Please use a desktop or larger display.

FLAVOR_ANALYZER.HEADER: Need a flavor that’s not in our online PRIMETIME catalog?
FLAVOR_ANALYZER.DISCOVER_FLAVORS: Tap into our expansive offline portfolio of over 500,000 flavors! Our Portfolio Team can assist in identifying the perfect flavor for your needs. Tell us more about what you’re looking for.
FLAVOR_ANALYZER.ORDER_LIMITS: (** Minimum order quantities may apply and exceed standard PRIMETIME Flavors minimum orders. Certain applications excluded.)

PAYWALL.TITLE_1: Get new products to market faster with a free Knowde Marketplace account
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_1: Gain instant access to our marketplace of over 250,000 chemicals, ingredients and polymers from 8,000 suppliers. Browse, search, and filter to quickly compare products, find information, request documents, order samples, and get quotes directly from suppliers.
PAYWALL.TITLE_2: The fastest way to find the right raw materials for your products
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_2: Search and filter over 250,000 chemicals, ingredients and polymers, access documents and download starter formulations. Interact with over 8,000 suppliers whose representatives are ready to help. Sign up for a free Knowde Marketplace account today.
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_3: Create a free account to gain instant access to our marketplace of over 250,000 products and their documents.
